title: 113_s330
content: The "HIV Organ Policy Equity Act" allows the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network to adopt standards for organs infected with HIV. The "HIV Organ Policy Equity Act" allows for the transplantation of organs infected with HIV under specific conditions, including participation in approved clinical research or meeting certain transplant standards. A related amendment is made to the Public Health Service Act regarding organ procurement organizations. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include arranging for testing to identify organs infected with HIV. Technical amendments are made to Section 371(b)(1) of the Act. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include criteria, standards, and regulations for research on transplanting organs infected with HIV. The Secretary is required to develop and publish guidelines within 2 years of the enactment of the HIV Organ Policy Equity Act. The Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network will revise quality standards and the Secretary will update regulations to allow research on HIV-infected organs. The Secretary will review research results annually to determine if standards need revision. The Secretary may revise quality standards for donated organs infected with HIV and transplanting organs with different strains of HIV to ensure safety, based on research results.
